If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John England and starring John ‘Lucky’ Linderman, this movie knows that one doesn’t need to weigh the script down with brilliant storytelling (Spaniards dishonorably betraying Native Americans, Americans saving the damsel in distress) to make a great action flick. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat prowling in the neighborhood. MTV adoptive father, Doug Savant, has the difficult role of an affectionate, somewhat spastic father and friend.
It’s an odd hybrid hybrid of Rosemary’s Baby with a Peeping Tom, a sequel to Teen Mom, or just an impostor on your HBO account
